required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessing the Safety and Tolerability of a Single IV Dose of AZD9742 in Healthy Elderly Male and Female Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Double-blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled Study to Assess the Safety and Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of a Single Dose of AZD9742 in Healthy Elderly Male and Female Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to examine the safety and tolerability of a single dose of AZD9742 in elderly individuals.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the safety and tolerability of a single intravenous dose of AZD9742 in healthy elderly adults.
primary_outcome.time_frame: The screening period is up to 28 days. Residential period will be a total of 5 days. Follow up will occur between 5 and 10 days after discharge.
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events, vital signs, electrocardiograms, telemetry, physical exams, and clinical laboratory assessments will be assessed prior to, during, and after treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the pharmacokinetics of a single intravenous dose of AZD9742 in healthy elderly volunteers
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood and urine samples will be collected for the 4 days while in residence.

arm_group.description: Single dose of 750mg of intravenous AZD9742 in healthy elderly volunteers

intervention.description: Sterile solution, 620 mg (20 mg/mL) in 50 mL vial with a fill volume of 31 mL

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female volunteers at age of 65 years or older with suitable veins for cannulation or repeated venipuncture, in good health (based on medical history and physical examination and clinical laboratory tests) as judged by the investigator.
- Female volunteers must be postmenopausal (cessation of regular menses for 12 months and a follicle stimulating hormone level of more than 40IU/L abd estradiol of less than 20ng/mL.
- Male volunteers should be willing to use barrier contraception, ie, condoms, from the day of dosing until 3 months after dosing with the investigational product.
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of any clinically significant disease or disorder which, in the opinion of the Investigator, may either put the volunteer at risk because of participation in the study, or influence the results or the volunteer's ability to participate
- History or presence of GI, hepatic, or renal disease or any other condition known to interfere with absorption, distribution, metabolism, or excretion of drugs as judged by Investigator.
- Any clinically significant illness, medical/surgical procedure, or trauma within 4 weeks of the first administration of investigational product

overall_official.affiliation: Bio-Kinetic 1816 W. Mt Vernon, Springfield, MO 65802

clinical_study.keyword: Safety and tolerability of single intravenous dose of AZD9742 in healthy elderly volunteers
